info_response.label: Note that between these responses, the last overcomes others above. I.e. a subscribed moderator will have moderator message, while a subscribed VIP will have subscriber message. If any field is empty, the level above will be used, or everyone's message.
info_response.tooltip: Note that between these responses, the last overcomes others above. I.e. a subscribed moderator will have moderator message, while a subscribed VIP will have subscriber message. If any field is empty, the level above will be used, or everyone's message.

tts_alias_list.label: Alias to apply to users
tts_alias_list.tooltip:
You can set aliases for users, if you want them to be named differently. Expressed with 'User:Alias' couples separated by semicolon.
Note: In those cases, blacklisted words check will be applied on aliases.

no_start_greet.label: Don't greet messages starting by
no_start_greet.tooltip: Messages starting this ways will not be greeted.

do_not_greet.label: Users not to greet + Blacklisted words
do_not_greet.tooltip:
Users to not greet (like bots) and words you want to get filtered. Seperated through commas. Coupled through plus symbol.
All users containing this text, will not be greeted.

msg_volume.label: Volume new message audio
msg_volume.tooltip: Volume to play new message sound.

no_start_msg.label: Ignore messages starting by
no_start_msg.tooltip: Messages starting this ways will be ignored.

do_not_msg.label: Users not to check messages
do_not_msg.tooltip:
Users to not check messages (like bots). Seperated through commas.
Only full usernames, no alias or blacklist words.

custom_greet.label: Text custom greetings collection
custom_greet.tooltip:
A series of greet messages, each surrounded by quotation marks.
To set a "nothing" option, just write two quotation marks with no text inside, like this "" .

custom_audio.label: Audio custom greetings collection
custom_audio.tooltip:
A series of sound files, each surrounded by quotation marks.
To set a "nothing" option, just write two quotation marks with no text inside.

custom_greet_tts.label: TTS custom greetings collection
custom_greet_tts.tooltip:
A series of sentences to be read by text to speach, each surrounded by quotation marks.
To set a "nothing" option, just write two quotation marks with no text inside, like this "" .

custom_user.label: Users assignment to custom greetings
custom_user.tooltip:
This field allows to assign custom text, audio and TTS greetings to single users.
Given the sequence in previews three fields, the format is "NickName:TextIndex:AudioIndex:TTSIndex" surrounded by quotation marks.

The index of text, audio and TTS is given by their position, starting with 1 as first text, first audio or first TTS in the list, and so on for second (2), third (3)... while 0 or negative means no customization assigned = use default.
Zero or negative is optional for last values. It means "NickName:1" is like "NickName:1:0:0".

Note: script's default settings nicknames are fictional, they don't actually mean the very first, second and third users chatting in your channel. They mean to be replaced with actual real nicknames from your community.

tts_bot_on.label: Turn ON TTS Bot
tts_bot_on.tooltip: Do you wish a voice to read user's name.

tts_volume_on.label: Alter volume?
tts_volume_on.tooltip: Alter volume of TTS generated file?

tts_pitch_on.label: Alter pitch?
tts_pitch_on.tooltip:
Alter pitch of TTS generated file?
Note: Pitch will still influece speed final effect, if alter speed is enabled.

tts_speed_on.label: Alter speed?
tts_speed_on.tooltip:
Alter speed of TTS generated file?
Note: Pitch value will also be involted, even if alter pitch is disabled.

tts_case.label: Force lower or upper case
tts_case.tooltip: Set this if you want TTS to read lowercase (could avoid acronyms reading on uppercase words) or uppercase (could read words as acronym).

tts_chars_swapping.label: Character series to swap
tts_chars_swapping.tooltip:
Swaps series of characters with another series, if you want them to be spelled differently. Expressed with 'Chars:Swaps' couples separated by semicolon.
Note: at the contrary of aliases, as for the option above, this option is case sensitive but swaps also partial words, so it could be invasive and create oddities. Be sure to use the most rich series of characters possible.

tts_replaces.label: Replace these with spaces
tts_replaces.tooltip: For each character in here, replaces each occurrence of it with a white space, so TTS will not read them literally.

tts_confirm.label: Settings update confirmation
tts_confirm.tooltip: TTS will say this sentence to confirm settings are updated successfully.

tts_params.label: Custom parameters
tts_params.tooltip:
These parameters will fill the webservice call, replacing in order {2}, {3} and so on.
They have to be enclosed in quotation marks.
{0} and {1} are not included because they'll be {0} = text to read and {1} = lang.
If your webservice lang format is different than default (i.e not: 'en-GB', 'fil-PH', 'it-IT') you can set it as custom parameter.

tts_webservice.label: Webservice
tts_webservice.tooltip: The webservice to be called for TTS services. {0}, {1} and so on will be replaced by parameters, in order, as for previous field.

tts_audio_format.label: Audio format
tts_audio_format.tooltip: Audio file extention generated by TTS service.
